channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

DescribePack: CONTAINER LEAKED FROM A LOOSE CAP APPROX 3 LITERS LEAKED OUT DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO THE HAZMAT CAGE, SECURED, REPACKED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH.

X-2023080292 SequenceEvent: Attached is the Hazmat Material Certification Brandon Burke reported hazmat spill while performing a yard check at 7:20pm Gineyra Rios reported the spill to Sabrina Dazulma, Hector Morales, and Ugo at 7:30pm John Shearin and Sabrina Dazulma checked the Hazmat Materials Certifications for all the packages on the trailer at 7:55 UN2031 and UN2789 SDS sheet indicated that a Respirator was needed. Michael Henn was called at 7:59pm Emergency Spill Response was called at 8:18am Emergency Spill Response onsite at - will update on final email Emergency Spill Response left the site at - will update on final email Trailer: #562866 Driver: Luis Gonzalez Contractor: BAL Serivices PSA/CSA: 129943 DescribePack: Not secured on the pallet DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Emergency Spill Response was called for clean up. 2. item.title: Report X-2023080221
item.description:
Report X-2023080221

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVER NIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS LEAKAGE. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION 1 PLASTIC JERRICAN CONTAINING BONDERITE WAS FOUND SLIGHTLY LEAKING FROM THE BOTTOM. THE JERRICAN WAS PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: THE CAUSED OF FAILURE WAS DUE TO IMPORPER HANDLING WHILE LOADING. THE PLASTIC JERRICAN WAS SLIGHTLY LEAKING DUE TO A PUNCTURE AT THE BOTTOM. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE PLASTIC JERRICAN WAS PLACED IN A LINED SALAVGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023080217
item.description:
Report X-2023080217

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF LEAKAGE. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION THE BOX CONTAINING SUNNYSIDE DENATURED ALCOHOL WAS FOUND WITH ONE OF THE CANS HALF LEAKED OUT. THEY WERE HURRIEDLY PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE PACKAGE WAS DUE TO A PUNCTURE AT THE BOTTOM OF 1 CAN OF DENATURED ALCOHOL HALF WAY LEAKED OUT. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALAVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION

item.title: Report I-2023070025
item.description:
Report I-2023070025

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-21T15:11:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: Dayton
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAST PENN LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The driver picked up a load of Industrial Motive Power Batteries from a customer in Dayton, NJ. The batteries looked to be secured to the pallets and the pallets looked to be in good, sturdy condition. The driver traveled about 2 miles down the road to a stop light. While pulling away from the light he heard a bang coming from his trailer. He pulled over as soon as he found a safe place to do so along a ramp going onto the Turnpike. When he opened the trailer to check the load he saw that one of the batteries had fallen over due to a pallet collapsing. THere was no harsh braking, acceleration or cornering events to trigger the spill. He then checked the rest of the load and saw that there were other pallets that were not looking as stable as they should be. The driver did have some soda ash on his truck which he used to soak up, neutralize and berm as much of the spilled acid as he could. He did call back to Corporate for help with the clean up. The police showed up to the scene. After assessing the spill and seeing that the trailer is no longer leaking the police assisted the driver to tum his truck around and off the Turnpike ramp for easier assistance for clean up. The Hazmat clean up team arrived shorlty after the turnaround. While wating for the Hazmat clean up team, the driver contacted the cutomer that he picked up the batteries from since they were a few miles down the road asking if they would take back his load and help up-right the battery that had spilled. They accepted. The police gave the driver permission to drive back to the custmer with the Hazmat clean up team following to make sure that nothing leaked from the trailer during transit. Nothing leaked during the move. The police informed the driver that they will have the trunpike maintenacne clean up the spilled area on the ramp. Once back at the cusomer, the customer unloaded the load and helped to up-right the spilled battery. They are going to re-palletize ALL the batteries and put them on better/ stronger pallets for a future pick up. The Hazmat team cleaned out the trailer and will take care of the clean up waste. Once the trailer was cleaned the driver returned home with an

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one metal 55 gallon drum of butyl acetates (un1123) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 0.5 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

  • Description: A leaking fiberboard box was discovered during the unloading process at the EWRH facility. The fiberboard box contained four glass bottles and one of the bottles was broken. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for an amended shippers declaration.
